$schema.description: Links to the JSON schema (the thing generating these descriptions), don't change this!

port.description: Port the application should run on.

clientUrls.description:
Client origin URLs for server to use in CORS middleware.
In other words, requests from these websites will work on their end instead of giving a security error.
An empty array is equivalent to the wildcard "*", meaning any website.

numProxies.description:
Number of proxies (eg. Cloudflare, AWS ELB, NGINX) between client and server. Used for rate limiting functionality.
 For more info see https://www.npmjs.com/package/express-rate-limit#:~:text=Troubleshooting%20Proxy%20Issues

maxRequestsPerMinute.description:
Maximum number of requests a client can make to the API in a 1 minute window.
Remember that requests with a valid "RateLimit-Bypass-Token" header will ignore this.

rateLimitBypassTokens.description: Requests with any of these in their "RateLimit-Bypass-Token" header will bypass rate limiting.

mongoURI.description: URI to connected to a MongoDB database with.

mongoDbName.description: Name of the database in MongoDB, will be created if it does not yet exist.

jwtSecret.description: String to sign JSON Web Tokens with, should not be easy to guess.

jwtDuration.description:
How long sessions should last for before needing a refresh.
Expressed in seconds or a string describing a time span (zeit/ms).

discordClientId.description: OAuth2 client ID of your Discord application.

discordClientSecret.description: OAuth2 client secret of your Discord application.
